title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.39 | 25-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 39th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam that will be discussed.
segments.transcript: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvijesha Jhunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda Shri Advaita Galadhara Srivasa Ali Gauravakta Vrinda Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Muthirayet

segments.key_quote: After responsibly handing over charge To Parvatiya
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of the verse, focusing on Yudhishthira's actions of placing Vajra as king and preparing to renounce household life after handing over responsibilities.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 39th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. Mathurayam Tatha Vajram Shura Sena Patim Tathaha Prajapatyam Nirupyeshtim Agneen Apibad Ishwaraha. The meaning of this 39th verse is: Then he posted Vajra, the son of Aniruddha. Aniruddha was the grandson of Lord Krishna at Mathura. That means Vajra, who was the great-grandson of Krishna, was posted by Yudhishthira at Mathura as the king of Shura Sena. Afterwards, Maharaj Yudhishthira performed a Prajapatiya sacrifice and placed in himself the fire for quitting household life. He prepared himself to quit household life after responsibly handing over charge to Parvatiya.

segments.key_quote: So one must quit household life and become detached renounced from all household life attachments from all family attachments from all material attachments saw Srila Prabhupada
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of detachment and renunciation, emphasizing the importance of the Varnashrama Dharma system based on quality and work for real human life.
segments.transcript: And one person who we have mentioned, and who has mentioned, everything is related to the Prajapatiya. They affect people, situating themselves. This flows in the way of wholesale. It is meant to be. So, if you remember that before, he had... It will be life, and for quitting household life, he has to actually become detached. Quitting does not mean go away from home and carry within the heart all the attachment for household life. No, that is not the way to quit. So, Srila Prabhupada explained this phrase, "placed in himself the fire for quitting household life." Prabhupada explains in the purport: "Maharaja Yudhishthira, after placing Maharaja Pariksit on the imperial throne of Hastinapura and after posting Vajra, the great-grandson of Lord Krishna, as king of Mathura, accepted the renounced order of life." So, one must quit household life and become detached, renounced from all household life attachments, from all family attachments, from all material attachments. So, Srila Prabhupada explains the system of four orders of life and four castes in terms of quality and work, known as Varna-ashrama Dharma, is the beginning of real human life. Varana ashrama for Varanas according to occupational characteristics, occupational duties: Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shudra, all are qualified differently according to the acquired nature. Sattvic people, Rajasic people, mixed Rajoguna and Tamoguna, and Tamsic people.

segments.key_quote: So, human life, real human life means Varnashrama dharma.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the four Ashramas (Brahmacharya, Grihastha, Vanaprastha, Sannyas) as a system for gradual spiritual elevation, highlighting Yudhishthira Maharaj's example of retiring from active life and becoming detached.
segments.transcript: So, they should work to maintain themselves for the sake of fixing the ultimate goal of life as self-realization. Not only for Brahmanas, not only for some people, it's for even the Shudras. It's for every human being within the Varnashrama system. Every human being. Four Varnas. And then four Ashramas. What are the four Ashramas? Brahmacharya, Grihastha, Vanaprastha, Sannyas. These four Ashramas are for gradual spiritual elevation. So, now Yudhishthira Maharaj is quitting household life in order to enter the stage where one completely dedicates his life for preparing for going back to Godhead, with no other responsibilities, no other duties, because all those responsibilities and duties have been handed over to the son or the grandson or somebody else younger. So, human life, real human life means Varnashrama dharma. This is explained in the scriptures. Maharaj Yudhishthira, as the protector of this system of human activities, timely retired from active life as a sanyasi, handing over the charge of the administration to a trained prince, Maharaj Pariksit. He became detached and renounced after handing over charge.

segments.key_quote: So, these stages are natural and very scientific and progressive for somebody whose ultimate aim of life is to go back to Godhead at the end of this life.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of Varnashrama Dharma and the four Ashramas for achieving the ultimate goal of going back to Godhead, emphasizing that this goal is for every human being due to their developed intelligence.
segments.transcript: So, Srila Prabhupada says further, "The scientific system of Varnashrama dharma divides the human life into four divisions of occupation and four orders of life." So, Srila Prabhupada elaborates what I just explained. The four orders of life as Brahmachari, Grhastha, Vanaprastha, and Sanyasi are to be followed by all, irrespective of the occupational division. If somebody is serious about going back home, back to Godhead, they should follow these divisions that are made in the ashrama system. Brahmachari means student life, and Grhastha means householder life, and Vanaprastha means retired life, and Sanyasa means renounced or detached life. So, these stages are natural and very scientific and progressive for somebody whose ultimate aim of life is to go back to Godhead at the end of this life. Before quitting the body, one has to prepare. Now, this goal is for every human being, because human being has developed, developed intelligence, developed consciousness, developed understanding, developed brain. That is the meaning of human life.

segments.key_quote: But as far as spiritual development is concerned, spiritual advancement is concerned, all are eligible.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that everyone is eligible for spiritual advancement and highlights the necessity of guidance from a bona fide spiritual master (Acharya) who preaches without discrimination.
segments.transcript: Now, relatively speaking, one may be more intelligent than the other in terms of some material calculation. But as far as spiritual development is concerned, spiritual advancement is concerned, all are eligible. All are meant for spiritual elevation. Of course, this has to be practiced under the proper direction of the bona fide spiritual master. You require spiritual guidance, not of any ordinary person, but one who is actually qualified, a bona fide spiritual master, Acharya. Therefore, you can see in our culture, in our tradition, there have been acharyas who have preached to the mass of people without discrimination: Madhvacharya, Ramanujacharya, Shankaracharya, and acharyas. So, Prabhupada is the acharya for our times.

segments.key_quote: So Prabhupada said, translate his books into the local language and distribute those books in those languages.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Srila Prabhupada's tireless preaching efforts, including translating and distributing books in various languages, to help people awaken their dormant Krishna consciousness.
segments.transcript: And he travelled all over the world and preached to everyone, all sections of people in the society. Prabhupada was preaching to everyone tirelessly. He travelled, he wrote books, and he instructed his disciples who were dedicated for this preaching mission in assisting Srila Prabhupada to preach to everyone in the world. He was instructing them to translate these books into all the possible languages of the different parts of the world, because somebody may not be educated in English. So then, they can read their local language. So Prabhupada said, translate his books into the local language and distribute those books in those languages. So, Prabhupada's teachings, Prabhupada's instructions, Prabhupada's explanations are available in all the major languages of the world today. So, people can read that and learn from the devotees how to practice Krishna consciousness simply by beginning with chanting Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare. Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare. Now, by chanting and associating with devotees and hearing or reading these books in their respective languages, people can actually awaken their dormant Krishna consciousness which is already there in everyone's heart.

segments.key_quote: They can awaken their Krishna consciousness and actually start making progress simply by beginning with chanting
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna consciousness can be awakened through chanting and association with devotees, emphasizing the preciousness of the human form of life and the inherent inquisitiveness of children.
segments.transcript: They can awaken their Krishna consciousness and actually start making progress simply by beginning with chanting and gradually becoming more interested in the spiritual subject matter which is appealing to every human being, especially every human being. Actually, it is meant for all living beings, all spirit souls in all forms of life. But, the human form is special, that every human being has already got the brain substance to understand the importance of spiritual life. Every human being has got it. Therefore, you can see the inquisitiveness in a child which is born in any type of family, any type of background, doesn't matter. The inquisitiveness is indicated when the child begins to speak. It begins asking all kinds of questions from the parents. Any child which begins to talk, any mother will testify to this. All mothers will testify that when it begins to speak, it keeps on asking questions, questions, questions. What is this? What is that? What is this? What is that? Why this? Why that? Now, which means that, now this is true for a child born of poor parents, rich parents, Indian parents, American parents, educated parents, uneducated parents. It's true for all children. That is why our scriptures say human form is very, very precious.

segments.key_quote: That's the duty of the parents.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the importance of directing children towards Brahma Jigyasa (spiritual inquiry), seeking guidance from an Acharya, and spiritualizing existence through chanting Hare Krishna and partaking Prasadam (food offered to Krishna), making Krishna consciousness accessible to everyone.
segments.transcript: That's why the scriptures say that. So, that inquisitiveness, Jigyasa, should be directed towards Brahma Jigyasa. Athato Brahma Jigyasa. That's the duty of the parents. And the parents are actually meant to direct the child to the Acharya, to the bona fide spiritual master. And Acharyas preach to everyone how to begin spiritual life by chanting Hare Krishna and how to progress by simple, very, very simple practices: offering food and eat, partaking the remnants of Prasadam. Everybody eats. But then don't simply eat like animals. You take Prasadam and spiritualize your entire existence. Ahara Shuddhau Sattva Sattva Shuddhihi. This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita by Srila Prabhupada. Ahara Shuddhau Sattva Shuddhihi. You take purified foodstuff, your existence itself, Sattva existence becomes purified. The entire body becomes purified. The mind becomes purified. The intelligence becomes purified. So it's so important that people be taught to chant Hare Krishna and offer the food they are eating to Krishna and then partake the remnants of such food offered to Krishna, Prasadam, Krishna Prasadam. This is possible for every human being irrespective of who they are, what their social status is, or what their economic condition is. It's possible for everybody, because everybody is eating something for their survival. So it's possible for everybody. They have to be properly directed, guided. Guidance is required. Now in taking guidance, there is no discrimination to be made. Even the most intellectually developed person also requires his guidance. And of course, those who are not so intelligent or those who are not so intellectually developed, they also require guidance. Everyone requires guidance. That direction is given by the Acharya. So simply by this, it's possible for everyone to become Krishna conscious and prepare themselves to go back home, back to God. I'll stop here. Thank you very much.
